intro: Ophthalmophyllum longum, commonly known as the long-stemmed eyeplant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Ophthalmophyllum longum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and unique flower structure.
